status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving. The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride. What the constituent observed was the patch awaiting for the final top course phase. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department.

The city is violating its own nondiscrimination laws by partnering with the Salvation Army and sending out emails suggesting city residents go there for various reasons -- Countdown to Kindergarten backpack event, 3D home workshops, etc. The Salvation Army is a homophobic church and their website says right on it that being gay or lesbian is a sin. They aren't required to abide by state and city nondiscrimination laws because they are legally a church. The city could be liable if residents attending these events are subject to discrimination while at the facility. Please stop supporting them and stop using city time and money to direct residents to a homophobic church. Partner with worthwhile nonsectarian organizations instead, like ABCD, Boys and Girls Club, etc.

Dear Mayor Menino,

I am a subsidized tenant of the city of Boston and on April 12, 2013 a fire occurred at my residency of 3 Monadnock St, Dorchester MA, 02125. During the fire, our Fire Detectors and smoke alarms did not sound. Upon review of the building after the fire, my building received many Building Code violations and hefty fines. The 43 families who lives in the building, we're displaced.


During the displacement of our building due to the fire, our building Management placed about 10-15 families in other vacant apartments but refused to relocate us or give us any financial assistance during our time of need, but still continues to collect our percentage of subsidy from the government. I have been verbally disrespected and shown no attention by my building management and been threatened to have my lease terminated if I attempt to bring light to this unjust situation. An elderly female neighbor of mine with no financial means to find shelter was forced to sleep on a park bench. Another female neighbor and her children are eating, sleeping and living out of their car. Myself and other neighbors of mine are creating huge financial debts with renting hotel rooms on a Nightly basis and dining out daily.

Can you please help investigate this unjust situation. We are a group of subsidized tenants with no extra financial income to hire a lawyer to fight our Land Lord. We have spent 3 months already wondering where we are going to sleep at each night. Mentally, emotionally and physically my neighbors and I are becoming more and more unstable. If you have an ounce of decency in you, please help shine some light on this Slum Lord called Abrams Management.

ABRAMS MANAGEMENT ADDRESS:
621 COLUMBUS AVE
ROXBURY MA, 02118

ADDRESS OF BUILDING:
3 MONADNOCK ST
DORCHESTER MA, 02125

Thank You for your time.

Anonymously,

The Sleepless Tenant

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. The PWD Roadway Repair Contractor is working on your street performing patch paving. The construction process is to dig out 6.5 inches of material and place 5 inches of dense binder hot mix asphalt in 2 lifts. The dense binder gives the patch its strength but is has large stones and is not conducive to providing a smooth ride, the contractor usually within a week comes back and places 1.5 inches of  the top course. The top course is hot mix asphalt  that provides the smooth ride. What the constituent observed was the patch awaiting for the final top course phase. The city apologizes for the inconvenience the work caused. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office. 617-438-8517 Cell.

My two year old son once grabbed the lighters from his stroller, while I payed for my items. I would like to know if city/commonwealth regulations allow cigarette lighters to be placed in a location easily accessible to minors, or if this is a violation. Thank you.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. National Grid is installing a new gas main.  The city encourages this type of capital upgrade work.  It will eliminate future emergency repairs. . National Grid has to install the gas main first.  Once the main has been installed, then all service connections can be made. . If the city were to make National Grid pave to grade each day's trench work,  it would cause multiple seams along the trench.  More importantly, every service connection needs to be cut into the trench.  If we were to pave the trench every day,  this would result in 2 by 2 patches inside the trench area, resulting in a very poor final product.  In order to have the best final paving, the city allows the utility company to leave the trench down low until all service connections are made and then pave the trench all at once, resulting in a smooth, level final trench repair.  Service laterals are topped within 24 hours of excavation. . What the constituent is observing is the trench left down low in preparation for one continuous final paving operation. . The trench is scheduled to be paved soon. . Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. Hello,. Thank you for contacting the Mayor?s Commission for Persons with Disabilities. We appreciate you submitting your comments for 12 Brewster Street, 526 East 8th Street, and 533 East 8th Street in South Boston. We have already begun an investigation, following the initial complaint we received regarding these locations. In our office, we have a formal process for investigating potential abuse of a Disabled Parking Space, and this process takes approximately a month. If you would like to follow up with our office regarding the investigation, please feel free to call the Mayor's Commission for Persons with Disabilities at (617) 635-3682. Again, thank you for taking the time to contact us and we hope to come to a resolution soon. In your comment, you also mentioned HP placard abuse. HP License Plates and Placards are run through the Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles. They have a process for investigating potential placard abuse, and you can find out more about that process on their website: http://www.massrmv.com/rmv/hp_complaint/index.htm. Thank you,. Mayor's Commission for Persons with Disabilities. Boston City Hall. One City Hall Square. Room 967. Boston, MA 02201. 617-635-3562 phone. disability@cityofboston.gov.
description: I opened a report two days ago with regards to people using their deceased relatives Handicap Placards. However, nothing was done about it. As you know there is a Parking Crunch in South Boston, and as soon as you send the message to these people that these abuses will not be tolerated, the sooner they will stop! That said, I believe when you assign a Handicap Placard/Parking Spot for specific People they should be removed when they pass away. Once again, the Addresses are...12 Brewster Street, 533 East Eighth Street, and the Woman at 526 East Eighth Street is STILL allowing her Daughter with Maine Plates to park in "her" spot all day! I'm trying to be nice here, but if nothing is done about this I will bring it to a "Higher Level"! Thank you.
